Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it was still entertaining enough for me to finish watching it. I like how they played with our senses to keep us wondering about what was real and what wasn't. I think there should be a different version of this movie that puts the focus differently - found footage-style and narration by Sam.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a Jackie Chan character but has just as many martial arts sequences and slapstick type comedy scenes as any one of Chan's movies and with far less budget.
